revised_title: Chemical Composition of Energetic Charged Particles in Interplanetary Space
tldr: This article discusses the chemical composition of energetic charged particles in interplanetary space, focusing on the Sun's role as a primary source. It reviews the particle population, the chemical composition of charged particles, and the composition below and above 100 nucleon energies. The article also explores the anomalous component, interplanetary active regions, and the effects of shocks on charged particles.
